alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Guilford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 5:19PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including Alamance and Guilford counties. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 517 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greensboro, High Point, Burlington, Graham, McLeansville, Elon, Summerfield, Gibsonville, Stokesdale, Pleasant Garden, Jamestown, Haw River, Swepsonville, Alamance, Lake Townsend Marina, Monticello, Lake Townsend, Forest Oaks, Lake Jeanette Marina and Lake Guilford Mackintosh Marina. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
